info.title: Pick and Pack API
info.description:
The Pick and Pack API provides comprehensive functionality for order management, picking operations, shipment tracking, and returns processing. The main capabilities include:

- Retrieving detailed order information, including items, packages, and status
- Accessing worksheet data for picking operations
- Querying shipment tracking and delivery details
- Getting facility information

## Authentication

- `POST` [Generate JWT token](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#post-/token)

## Orders

- `GET` [Get order by ID](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#get-/orders/-orderId-)
- `PATCH` [Set order delivery](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#patch-/orders/-orderId-/tracking)

## Worksheets

- `GET` [Get worksheet by ID](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#get-/worksheets/-worksheetId-)
- `GET` [Get worksheets by order ID](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#get-/worksheets)

## Facilities

- `GET` [Get facility by ID](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#get-/facilities/-facilityId-)

## Shipments

- `GET` [Get shipment](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#get-/shipments/-shipmentId-)
- `GET` [List shipments](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#get-/shipments/-orderId-)

## Common issues and solutions

In case of errors making a request, check the list of common issues and their solutions below.

### 1. Token expiration

- Authentication token expires after 15 minutes.  
- Check console logs for refresh attempt.  
- Verify `APIKEY_ACCOUNT` format.  
- Ensure that endpoint URLs are correct.  

### 2. Variable errors

- Check variable syntax.  
- Validate API key format.  

### 3. Cache-related issues

- Response data might appear stale due to API caching.  
- Endpoints have a specific cache duration of 30 seconds.  
- For real-time data, consider the cache duration when implementing polling strategies.  
- Cache is based on specific parameters (e.g., `orderId`, `shipmentId`).

servers.description: Server to access the authentication necessary to make a request in the Pick and Pack API.
Server to access the Pick and Pack API.

post.description:
Generates a `JWT` (JSON Web Token) necessary to access the Pick and Pack API information. To generate the `JWT` it's necessary to have the `API KEY`. To obtain this information, access **VTEX Admin > Shipping > Pick and Pack > Settings > Integration > API Key**.

>ℹ️ The authentication token expires after 15 minutes 

## Permissions

Any user or [API key](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/api-authentication-using-api-keys) must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint:

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| --------------- | ----------------- | ----------------- |
| Catalog | Administration | **Homepage** |
| Catalog | Administration | **Help home page** |

You can [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) with that resource or use one of the following [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy):

| **Role** | **Resource** | 
| --------------- | ----------------- | 
| Admin - Start page only | Homepage |
| Admin - Start page only | Help home page |

>❗ Assigning a [predefined role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) to users or API keys usually grants permission to multiple [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3). If some of these permissions are not necessary, consider creating a custom role instead. For more information regarding security, see [Best practices for using API keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-api-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm). To learn more about machine authentication at VTEX, see [Authentication overview](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication).

apiKey.description: The `API KEY` generated in **VTEX Admin > Shipping > Pick and Pack > Settings > Integration > API Key**.

servers.description: Server to access the authentication necessary to make a request in the Pick and Pack API.

get.description:
Retrieves order details by its ID.

>ℹ️ The response is cached for 30 seconds based on the `orderId` parameter. The endpoint supports up to 500 requests per second, with a maximum of 100 concurrent requests.

>ℹ️ [Generate a JWT token](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#post-/token) to endpoint authentication. JSON Web Token (JWT) is an open standard (RFC 7519) that defines a compact and self-contained way for securely transmitting information as a JSON object between parties.

## Permissions

Any user or [API key](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/api-authentication-using-api-keys) must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint:

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| --------------- | ----------------- | ----------------- |
| Catalog | Administration | **Homepage** |
| Catalog | Administration | **Help home page** |

You can [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) with that resource or use one of the following [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy):

| **Role** | **Resource** | 
| --------------- | ----------------- | 
| Admin - Start page only | Homepage |
| Admin - Start page only | Help home page |

>❗ Assigning a [predefined role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) to users or API keys usually grants permission to multiple [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3). If some of these permissions are not necessary, consider creating a custom role instead. For more information regarding security, see [Best practices for using API keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-api-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm). To learn more about machine authentication at VTEX, see [Authentication overview](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication).

schema.description: Order with status, timing, items, packages, invoices, and payments.

orderId.description: Unique order identifier assigned by the platform.

createdAt.description: Order creation date and time in ISO 8601 format.

updatedAt.description: Order last update date and time in ISO 8601 format.

shippingEstimatedDateMin.description: Minimum estimated shipping date and time in ISO 8601 format.

tags.description: List of free-form tags associated with the order.

pickingTime.description: Time spent in picking stage, in minutes (decimal).

packingTime.description: Time spent in packing stage, in minutes (decimal).

shippingTime.description: Time spent in shipping stage, in minutes (decimal).

items.description: Invoice entry with key and total.

invoiceTotal.description: Total invoice amount in minor currency units.

unhandledItems.description: Order unhandled items, not yet processed to a final state.

originalQuantity.description: Quantity originally ordered before any adjustments.

replacedBy.description: List of unhandled item replaced by.

weighableProduct.description: Indicates if the product was sold by weight (`true`) or not (`false`).

unitMultiplier.description: Unit multiplier applied to the item.

originalUnitMultiplier.description: Original unit multiplier before any changes.

unitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure for the item.

items.description: Reason entry explaining an exception or change.

reasonDetail.description: Reason for the unhandled item, such as out-of-stock.

pickers.description: Identifiers of pickers who handled this line.

warehouses.description: List of warehouse allocation or availability for this item.

rejectedItems.description: List of items that were rejected, for example due to being out-of-stock.

id.description: Rejected item identifier within the order.

quantity.description: Final quantity for this rejected item.

servers.description: Server to access the Pick and Pack API.

patch.description:
This endpoint finalizes the Pick and Pack workflow by marking the order as delivered. Additionally, it allows you to update the OMS with shipping details. All fields are optional. For more information, see [Update order tracking status](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/orders-api#put-/api/oms/pvt/orders/-orderId-/invoice/-invoiceNumber-/tracking) endpoint.

>ℹ️ [Generate a JWT token](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#post-/token) to endpoint authentication. JSON Web Token (JWT) is an open standard (RFC 7519) that defines a compact and self-contained way for securely transmitting information as a JSON object between parties.

## Permissions

Any user or [API key](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/api-authentication-using-api-keys) must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint:

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| --------------- | ----------------- | ----------------- |
| Catalog | Administration | **Homepage** |
| Catalog | Administration | **Help home page** |

You can [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) with that resource or use one of the following [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy):

| **Role** | **Resource** | 
| --------------- | ----------------- | 
| Admin - Start page only | Homepage |
| Admin - Start page only | Help home page |

>❗ Assigning a [predefined role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) to users or API keys usually grants permission to multiple [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3). If some of these permissions are not necessary, consider creating a custom role instead. For more information regarding security, see [Best practices for using API keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-api-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm). To learn more about machine authentication at VTEX, see [Authentication overview](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication).

get.description:
Retrieves worksheet details by ID.

>ℹ️ The response is cached for 30 seconds based on the `worksheetId` parameter. The endpoint supports up to 500 requests per second, with a maximum of 100 concurrent requests.

>ℹ️ [Generate a JWT token](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#post-/token) to endpoint authentication. JSON Web Token (JWT) is an open standard (RFC 7519) that defines a compact and self-contained way for securely transmitting information as a JSON object between parties.

## Permissions

Any user or [API key](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/api-authentication-using-api-keys) must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint:

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |

| Catalog | Administration | **Homepage** |
| Catalog | Administration | **Help home page** |

If some of these permissions are not necessary, consider creating a custom role instead. For more information regarding security, see [Best practices for using API keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-api-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm). To learn more about machine authentication at VTEX, see [Authentication overview](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication).

priority.description: Worksheet-level priority score. Higher score means higher priority.

notes.description: List of notes related to this assignment.

date.description: Date and time when the note was created.

finishedDate.description: Date and time when the assignment was finished.

totalCompletedItems.description: Total of items completed in this worksheet.

totalPackedItems.description: Total of items packed in this worksheet.

updatedAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of the last update to this worksheet record.

lastStatusChangeTime.description: Last status change time in milliseconds.

totalItems.description: Total number of items in the worksheet.

ordersIds.description: Orders associated with the worksheet and their summaries.

items.description: Order summary linked to this worksheet.

totalValue.description: Total order value in minor currency units.

itemsQuantity.description: Number of distinct items in the order.

shippingEstimatedDate.description: Estimated shipping date and time for the order in ISO 8601.

priority.description: Priority score for the order within the worksheet.

facilityId.description: Identifier of the facility where picking occurs.

items.description: All items in this worksheet with categories, assignment, and per-order breakdown.

replacedItems.description: Items that were substituted by alternatives.

listPrice.description: List price per unit in minor currency units.

quantity.description: Units originally assigned to this order for the item.

replacedQuantity.description: Units that were replaced by substitutes for this order.

currencyCode.description: ISO 4217 currency code for the prices.

unitMultiplier.description: Multiplier applied to the base unit for this allocation.

unitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure for the item.

originalUnitMultiplier.description: Original unit multiplier before any adjustments.

replacedBy.description: Identifiers of substitute items that replaced the original units.

reasons.description: Reasons explaining why replacements were made.

get.description:
Lists all worksheets by order ID.

>ℹ️ The response is cached for 30 seconds based on the `orderId` query parameter. The endpoint supports up to 500 requests per second, with a maximum of 100 concurrent requests.

>ℹ️ [Generate a JWT token](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#post-/token) to endpoint authentication. JSON Web Token (JWT) is an open standard (RFC 7519) that defines a compact and self-contained way for securely transmitting information as a JSON object between parties.

## Permissions

Any user or [API key](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/api-authentication-using-api-keys) must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. get.description:
Retrieves detailed information about a shipment using either the internal system ID or the carrier's tracking ID.

>ℹ️ The response is cached for 30 seconds based on the `shipmentId` parameter and `X-PNP-FilterMethod` header. The endpoint supports up to 500 requests per second, with a maximum of 100 concurrent requests.

>ℹ️ [Generate a JWT token](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/pick-and-pack-api#post-/token) to endpoint authentication. JSON Web Token (JWT) is an open standard (RFC 7519) that defines a compact and self-contained way for securely transmitting information as a JSON object between parties. 

## Permissions

Any user or [API key](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/api-authentication-using-api-keys) must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint:

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| --------------- | ----------------- | ----------------- |
| Catalog | Administration | **Homepage** |
| Catalog | Administration | **Help home page** |

You can [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) with that resource or use one of the following [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy):

| **Role** | **Resource** | 
| --------------- | ----------------- | 
| Admin - Start page only | Homepage |
| Admin - Start page only | Help home page |

>❗ Assigning a [predefined role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) to users or API keys usually grants permission to multiple [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3). If some of these permissions are not necessary, consider creating a custom role instead. For more information regarding security, see [Best practices for using API keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-api-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm). To learn more about machine authentication at VTEX, see [Authentication overview](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication).

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description: Shipment ID. Its value depends on the `X-PNP-FilterMethod` header. Use internal UUID when using `BY_INTERNAL_ID` filter or carrier tracking number when using `BY_EXTERNAL_ID` filter.

parameters.name: X-PNP-FilterMethod
parameters.description: Determines how the `shipmentId` will be interpreted. Its values can be `BY_INTERNAL_ID` or `BY_EXTERNAL_ID`.

schema.description: Shipment record with carrier, agent, package contents, tracking, and timing information.

orderId.description: Order identifier associated with this shipment.

carrierId.description: Internal or external identifier for the carrier.

serviceId.description: Carrier service identifier used to create the shipment.

seller.description: Selling entity or merchant of record.

agent.description: Delivery agent assigned to the shipment.

id.description: Identifier of the agent in the carrier system.

vehicle.description: Vehicle type used by the agent.

trackingUrl.description: Public tracking URL for this shipment.

totalDistanceTraveled.description: Total distance traveled for this delivery.

comments.description: Free-form comments or summary for the shipment.

evidences.description: Proof-of-delivery evidences such as photos or signatures.

items.description: Evidence record captured during pickup or delivery.

date.description: Timestamp when the evidence was captured (ISO 8601).

author.description: Person who captured or submitted the evidence.

items.description: Package with valuation, contents, and dimensions.

totalValue.description: Total declared value of the package in minor currency units.

orderId.description: Order identifier tied to this package.

weight.description: Package weight as a string in kilograms.

categories.description: Category labels describing the package contents.

quantity.description: Quantity of this item in the package.

price.description: Unit price in minor currency units.

width.description: Package width as a string in centimeters.

length.description: Package length as a string in centimeters.

height.description: Package height as a string in centimeters.

type.description: Fulfillment flow type for the job.

notes.description: Operational notes recorded during the shipment lifecycle.

date.description: Timestamp when the note was recorded (ISO 8601).

author.description: User or agent who created the note.

carrierServiceType.description: Service area/type offered by the carrier.

timezone.description: Timezone context used for the timestamps.

tags.description: Free-form tags associated with the shipment.

deliveredDate.description: Timestamp when the shipment was delivered (ISO 8601).

pickupDate.description: Pickup date and time at origin (ISO 8601).

deliveryDate.description: Delivery date and time at destination (ISO 8601).

labels.description: Label identifiers or URLs associated with the shipment (implementation-defined).

value.message: You do not have access to this shipment [da6c9988-7659-4cbd-bee3-5b44309eae07]
User is not authorized to access this resource with an explicit deny

servers.description: Server to access the Pick and Pack API.
